author: corisande.
title: Cortes de red en el sector de Lisieux, los clientes de SFR y Bouygues afectados
text:
Desde la noche del jueves 21 al viernes 22 de noviembre de 2024, se han registrado cortes en las redes mÃ³viles (3G, 4G y 5G) en el sector de Lisieux (Calvados). Los clientes de los operadores SFR y Bouygues se ven afectados, pero sigue siendo posible acceder a Internet a travÃ©s de cajas wifi en casa.
cerca
Los suscriptores de la red mÃ³vil de SFR y Bouygues Telecom ya no podrÃ¡n, desde la noche del jueves 21 al viernes 22 de noviembre de 2024, realizar y recibir llamadas ni acceder a Internet en el sector de Lisieux (Calvados), ya sea en 3G, 4G o 5G.
Se espera recuperaciÃ³n el lunes
Dos antenas, situadas en Lisieux y Beuvillers, se encuentran en mal estado. â€œdegradadoâ€probablemente por el episodio nevado. En la puerta de entrada de cristal de la tienda SFR de Lisieux, una hoja indica a los usuarios: â€œSe estÃ¡ resolviendo la falla de la red, espere. Â» Pero muchos suscriptores acudieron allÃ­ por la maÃ±ana para obtener informaciÃ³n. â€œEsto no paraâ€confiÃ³ un asesor.
La red seguÃ­a degradada este viernes al mediodÃ­a. Los dos operadores anuncian una restauraciÃ³n a mÃ¡s tardar el lunes 25 de noviembre.

author: webinfo@adnkronos.com (Web Info)
title: Israele-Hamas, nuovo round colloqui: si tratta sulla Philadelphi Route
text:
(Adnkronos) -
Nuovo round di colloqui per una tregua nella Striscia di Gaza. Il principale ostacolo per raggiungere un accordo sul cessate il fuoco e il rilascio degli ostaggi sembra essere il rifiuto del primo ministro israeliano, Benjamin Netanyahu, di ritirare i soldati dalla 'Philadelphi Route', il 'corridoio' di 14 chilometri che corre lungo il confine tra la Striscia di Gaza e l'Egitto. A indicarlo fonti israeliane citate da Maariv, mentre stasera al Cairo Ã¨ in programma un nuovo round di negoziati con Egitto, Usa e Israele.
Il capo dello Shin Bet, il capo del Mossad e il capo della divisione strategica delle Idf, il generale Eliezer Toledano, sono arrivati al Cairo per tentare di colmare le distanze sul 'corridoio'. La delegazione israeliana sarebbe arrivata al Cairo con una nuova proposta che prevederebbe la possibilitÃ  di una presenza permanente di un missione di osservatori delle Nazioni Unite in diversi punti fissi della 'Philadelphi Route', rivela il quotidiano del Qatar 'Al-Araby Al-Jadeed'. L'accordo, scrive il quotidiano, "prevederebbe la presenza di un'altra delegazione dell'Ue al valico di Rafah insieme ai rappresentanti dell'AutoritÃ  palestinese per gestire e riavviare il valico". Sempre secondo 'Al-Araby Al-Jadeed' "la proposta non prevede un ritiro immediato dell'esercito israeliano dal valico" ma prevederebbe "un ritiro graduale dal confine".
L'Egitto, che ha piÃ¹ volte ribadito di rifiutare qualsiasi dispiegamento israeliano permanente o a lungo termine sul lato palestinese del suo confine con Gaza, ha chiesto agli Stati Uniti garanzie specifiche riguardo al corridoio di Philadelphi, ovvero che se i soldati israeliani dovessero lasciare la 'Route' nella prima fase dell'accordo, non vi ritorneranno nelle successive. Lo riferiscono funzionari egiziani al Wall Street Journal, spiegando che i negoziatori israeliani hanno recentemente proposto di costruire otto torri di osservazione lungo l'asse. Gli Stati Uniti hanno cercato di offrire concessioni in base alle quali sarebbero state collocate solo due torri, ma l'Egitto ha rifiutato entrambe le proposte sulla base del fatto che ciascuna torre di controllo consente all'Idf la presenza permanente e l'accesso.
Sarebbero sette gli ostaggi rimasti nelle mani della Jihad Islamica, fazione palestinese alleata di Hamas che opera nella Striscia di Gaza. Lo ha riferito il quotidiano saudita con sede a Londra Asharq al-Awsat, ricordando che lo scorso 8 ottobre, all'indomani del massacro compiuto da Hamas nel sud di Israele, il leader del gruppo, Ziyad Nakhaleh, dichiarÃ² che la Jihad Islamica aveva in pugno oltre 30 dei 251 ostaggi portati a Gaza. Alcuni di loro sono stati rilasciati nell'ambito dell'accordo che a novembre portÃ² a una tregua di una settimana, nota il quotidiano, secondo cui non Ã¨ chiaro se qualcuno degli ostaggi nelle mani della Jihad Islamica sia morto.
Asharq al-Awsat ha riferito inoltre che la cooperazione tra Hamas e la Jihad Islamica si Ã¨ rafforzata dopo l'assassinio il mese scorso a Teheran del leader di Hamas, Ismail Haniyeh, non solo nella Striscia di Gaza ma anche in Cisgiordania, come testimoniato dal fallito attentato suicida compiuto da un residente di Nablus a Tel Aviv domenica scorsa, rivendicato da entrambi i gruppi.
Mentre sono stati trovati proiettili all'interno dei corpi di alcuni degli ostaggi che sono stati recuperati nei giorni scorsi dalle Idf nella Striscia di Gaza. Lo scrivono media israeliani senza nominare gli ostaggi in questione, ma sottolineando che probabilmente sono stati uccisi dai loro rapitori. La madre dell'ostaggio Yagev Buchshtav, 35 anni, ha detto alla radio Kan che un proiettile Ã¨ stato trovato nel corpo del figlio.
I corpi recuperati a Khan Younis sono, oltre a quello di Buchshtav, quelli di Alex Dancyg, Chaim Peri, Yoram Metzger, Nadav Popplewell e Avraham Munder.

author: Jerzy Lewandowski
title: Innovative AgTech Firm Deploys Drone Army to Boost Crop Health
text:
Innovative AgTech Firm Deploys Drone Army to Boost Crop Health
In a modern twist to pest management, UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture is redefining the use of technology in farming. Operating from California, this compact enterprise has garnered attention for its unique approach in maintaining crop wellbeing. Rather than relying on conventional pesticides, UAV-IQ utilizes drones as their prime agents, deploying swarms of tens of thousands of natural predators across agricultural lands.
By unleashing beneficial insects and mites from the skies, these drones efficiently combat harmful pests that threaten crops. This method not only embodies advanced technological use in agriculture but also symbolizes a commitment to environmentally friendly farming practices. The innovative strategy showcases how the integration of emerging tech and ecological mindfulness can revolutionize traditional agricultural methods.
UAV-IQâ€™s foray into aerial pest control reflects a seamless blend of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) with intelligent solutions, providing farmers with an effective, yet sustainable option to protect their yields. As drones take on a crucial role in agriculture, itâ€™s clear that UAV-IQ is at the forefront of this agricultural evolution, armed with their buzzing fleet ready to safeguard the fruits of labor on the ground.
Summary: UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture, based in California, is at the forefront of integrating technology with eco-friendly farming practices. Their utilization of drones to release beneficial predators over crops signifies a shift towards innovative and sustainable agricultural methodologies, promising a healthier future for farming.
FAQ Section Based on the Article
What is UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture?
UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture is a company based in California that specializes in integrating technology with farming practices to maintain crop health.
How does UAV-IQ manage pests?
Instead of conventional pesticides, UAV-IQ uses drones to deploy natural predators, such as beneficial insects and mites, to control harmful pests in agricultural lands.
Why is UAV-IQâ€™s method considered environmentally friendly?
Their method minimizes the use of chemical pesticides, opting for natural pest control solutions, which reduces environmental impact and promotes sustainable farming.
What are the benefits of using drones in agriculture?
Drones offer efficient and precise distribution of beneficial predators over wide areas of crops, leading to potentially reduced labor costs and better pest management.
What does the UAV-IQâ€™s approach signify for farming?
UAV-IQâ€™s strategy demonstrates a shift toward innovative and sustainable agricultural methods that combine emerging technologies with ecological mindfulness.
Definitions
â€“ UAV: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle, commonly known as a drone, is an aircraft without a human pilot aboard.
â€“ Pest Management: The process of monitoring and controlling pests to prevent them from causing damage to crops.
â€“ Beneficial Insects and Mites: Natural predators that feed on harmful pests, aiding in natural pest control.
â€“ Conventional Pesticides: Chemical substances used to kill or control the population of pest organisms.
Suggested Related Links
â€“
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
â€“
United States Department of Agriculture (USDA)
â€“
Federal Aviation Administration (FAA)
Please note that the URLs provided are to the main pages of organizations related to environmental protection, agriculture, and aviation regulations, which are relevant to the topics discussed in the article. Ensure that the links are entered correctly and are valid as requested.
Jerzy Lewandowski, a visionary in the realm of virtual reality and augmented reality technologies, has made significant contributions to the field with his pioneering research and innovative designs. His work primarily focuses on enhancing user experience and interaction within virtual environments, pushing the boundaries of immersive technology. Lewandowskiâ€™s groundbreaking projects have gained recognition for their ability to merge the digital and physical worlds, offering new possibilities in gaming, education, and professional training. His expertise and forward-thinking approach mark him as a key influencer in shaping the future of virtual and augmented reality applications.

author: Victoria Pease
title: Snowy conditions expected on Scottish roads as travel misery set to continue amid heavy rain warning | STV News
text: Travellers have been warned of more misery on the roads as plummeting temperatures could see major routes affected by snow. It comes as the clean up operation following Storm Gerrit gets under way, after thousands of homes were left without power amid heavy winds and driving rain. Motorists were caught up in treacherous driving conditions, with major roads such as the A9 and A90 impassable due to snow and flooding. The Met Office has now issued fresh yellow weather warnings for rain and snow from 8am on Saturday morning, stretching to 3pm for southern parts of Scotland including Dumfries and Galloway, Ayrshire and the Scottish Borders. Meanwhile other parts of the country including Angus, Fife, Perth and Kinross, the Highlands, Aberdeenshire, Moray, the Western Isles and Argyll and Bute will see the weather alert extended to shortly before midnight. As temperatures are set to dip to as low as -10C on Friday evening, Saturday could see more misery on the roads for travellers with up to 10cm of snow falling on higher routes such as the A9, A85, A95 and A96. It means many attempting to travel home following the festive period or heading to Hogmanay parties may be impacted by the latest weather warning. Meanwhile areas which were hit badly by flooding in recent days could see more of the same, with heavy rain expected in Dumfries and Galloway, Angus, Aberdeenshire and northern parts of the Highlands on Saturday. Insight [Sean Batty](/author/sean-batty) STV meterologist Here we go again â€“ well not quite as bad as Storm Gerrit, but another day with plenty of rain, and snow on high ground. After a cold night on Friday with temperatures as low as -10C in the Highlands, another weather front will be arriving from the west which will spread east across the country on Saturday bringing another bout of heavy rain â€“ again in areas that have seen the worst rainfall in recent days. The focus for the heaviest rain will be across Dumfries and Galloway, Angus, Aberdeenshire and the north Highlands where around 30-40mm of rain could fall. Again, this could lead to localised issues given the already saturated conditions with road and field flooding likely. Given the cold conditions initially, snow will fall with a risk of a few centimetres to low levels before turning back to rain. At higher levels snow will last longer with as much as 10cm above 250 metres. This means that higher routes such as the A9, A85, A95 and A96 are at threat of another very snowy spell for a time on Saturday which could lead to further travel issues. For those planning on Hogmanay travel on Sunday or on New Yearâ€™s Day, I have better news as the weather quietens down a bit, although there will still be some rain in the far north and west of the country. For most it should be largely dry for the bells, including Edinburgh â€“ great news for revellers heading to the big party in the capital to bring in 2024. Longer term, our focus for January is likely to be colder conditions with more widespread snowfall, especially as the month progresses. So we may well wave goodbye to the stormier conditions of 2023, but itâ€™s looking increasingly likely that colder air will usher in 2024. STV News is now on WhatsApp Get all the latest news from around the country [Follow STV News](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VaCESJzKgsNvKKNOYO2r) Follow STV News on WhatsApp Scan the QR code on your mobile device for all the latest news from around the country

author: EFE
title: Las claves del histÃ³rico triunfo de Carlos Sainz en el Dakar
text: El espaÃ±ol [Carlos Sainz](/tags/carlos-sainz/) (Audi) consiguiÃ³ este viernes su [cuarto Dakar](https://www.laopiniondezamora.es/deportes/2024/01/19/sainz-conquista-cuarto-dakar-cita-97094141.html), una ediciÃ³n en la que no logrÃ³ la victoria de ninguna de las doce etapas pero que, sin embargo, dominÃ³ de principio a fin, siendo lÃ­der durante toda la segunda semana. Â¿Pero cuÃ¡les fueron las claves de su victoria? Dominio en las tres etapas clave del Dakar Sainz llegaba con tres de las doce etapas subrayadas en rojo. Eran la primera, una jornada de piedras entre Al Ula y Al Henakiyah; la sexta, una etapa crono de 48 horas en la que los corredores se introducÃ­an en el desierto de dunas mÃ¡s grande del mundo, y la penÃºltima jornada, la de este pasado jueves, otra autÃ©ntica maratÃ³n de piedras antes de llegar a Yanbu. BordÃ³ las tres. El madrileÃ±o quedÃ³ segundo en la primera etapa, donde ya se distanciÃ³ del catarÃ­ Nasser Al-Attiyah (Prodrive), campeÃ³n de las dos anteriores ediciones y su mÃ¡ximo rival. Sainz terminÃ³ a 1 minuto y 44 segundos del primero, el belga Guillaume de Mevius (Toyota), y aventajÃ³ en mÃ¡s de 12 minutos al sueco Mattias EkstrÃ¶m (Audi), en 20 al francÃ©s SÃ©bastien Loeb (Prodrive), en 22 a Al-Attiyah y en casi media hora al francÃ©s StÃ©phane Peterhansel (Audi). Esto le dio confianza a Sainz, que llegÃ³ a la crono de 48 horas, la etapa reina del Dakar, segundo en la general. En la primera jornada de los dos dÃ­as que durÃ³ la etapa, Sainz sacÃ³ mÃ¡s de 25 minutos al catarÃ­, una autÃ©ntica minutada que permitÃ­a al espaÃ±ol ponerse lÃ­der provisional de la general. Por su parte, en el segundo dÃ­a de la etapa, Sainz bajÃ³ el pistÃ³n y terminÃ³ segundo, a unos cinco minutos de Loeb, aunque el espaÃ±ol habÃ­a asestado un autÃ©ntico golpetazo en la general. Y la Ãºltimo demostraciÃ³n de poder fue la vivida este pasado jueves, cuando Sainz liderÃ³ los primeros ocho tramos de la penÃºltima etapa, una empedrada jornada de 420 kilÃ³metros en la que muchos de sus rivales tuvieron problemas mecÃ¡nicos. SÃ³lo un pinchazo apeÃ³ a Sainz de la victoria en un dÃ­a que certificÃ³, aunque de panera virtual, su cuarto [triunfo en el Dakar](https://www.laopiniondezamora.es/deportes/2024/01/19/crlos-sainz-ganar-dakar-cuerda-97099834.html). Problemas de todos sus rivales [](/fotos/deportes/2024/01/19/mejores-imagenes-rally-dakar-2024-97095433.html) [31](/fotos/deportes/2024/01/19/mejores-imagenes-rally-dakar-2024-97095433.html) Toda la mala suerte que Sainz tuvo en ediciones pasadas, el espaÃ±ol la tuvo de cara en este 2024. El madrileÃ±o no tuvo ningÃºn problema mecÃ¡nico, aunque sÃ­ varios pinchazos. Por contra, casi todos sus rivales tuvieron alguna averÃ­a mecÃ¡nica o, directamente, destrozaron su coche. Es lo que le ocurriÃ³ al saudÃ­ Yazeed Al Rajhi (Toyota), quien estrellÃ³ su vehÃ­culo sobre las dunas en la sexta etapa justo cuando lideraba la general y no pudo volver a la carrera. Al dÃ­a siguiente, [Al-Attiyah](/tags/nasser-al-attiyah/), que se habÃ­a convertido en el mÃ¡ximo rival de Sainz tras la retirada de Al Rajhi, sufriÃ³ una averÃ­a mecÃ¡nica que le hizo perder mÃ¡s de una hora con el coche de Audi, lo mismo que le pasÃ³ al sueco Mattias EkstrÃ¶m (Audi), que cuando estaba a veinte minutos del espaÃ±ol estuvo varado durante mÃ¡s de dos horas, diciendo adiÃ³s a sus opciones de pelear por la general. En la penÃºltima etapa, cuando Loeb estaba a sÃ³lo 13 minutos de Sainz, el francÃ©s rompiÃ³ la horquilla delantera de la suspensiÃ³n, lo que acabÃ³ por tranquilizar al espaÃ±ol en el camino por su cuarto Dakar. PenalizaciÃ³n a Loeb De cara a la sexta jornada, ningÃºn corredor querÃ­a abrir pista en la etapa de 48 horas que se desarrollaba por el Empty Quarter, una de las partes mÃ¡s inhÃ³spitas del desierto de arena mÃ¡s grande del mundo. Por ello, todos los pilotos perdieron algo de tiempo en la quinta etapa para no estar entre los primeros y quedar relegados a la dÃ©cima o undÃ©cima posiciÃ³n, lo que les permitirÃ­a seguir las trazas de los de delante. Lo hizo Sainz, que se quedÃ³ parado durante varios minutos para asegurarse que no serÃ­a el primero en cruzar la lÃ­nea de meta y tambiÃ©n Loeb, que en su afÃ¡n de no ser primero no pasÃ³ por un â€˜waypointâ€™, uno de los puntos por los que el [Dakar ](/tags/rally-dakar/)cronometra a los pilotos, y recibiÃ³ una penalizaciÃ³n de quince minutos que le hubieran venido muy bien en la segunda semana de rally, cuando pugnaba con Sainz por el liderato. Nasser, a la suya, mientras Audi ayuda a Sainz Si le hubieran venido bien esos quince minutos, mejor aÃºn habrÃ­a sido para Loeb la ayuda de Nasser Al-Attiyah. Sin embargo, el catarÃ­ prefiriÃ³ no quedarse a ayudar a su compaÃ±ero y marcharse tras retirarse de la etapa por segundo dÃ­a consecutivo. Sin duda, podrÃ­a haber acompaÃ±ado a Loeb en las tres Ãºltimas etapas, sobre todo este jueves, cuando Loeb hubo de esperar mÃ¡s de una hora a que un piloto chino con su mismo vehÃ­culo le diera unas herramientas que Ã©l no tenÃ­a para arreglar su suspensiÃ³n y, posteriormente, llegÃ³ al campamento con tres de sus cuatro ruedas pinchadas, al quedarse sin neumÃ¡ticos de repuesto. Al-Attiyah podrÃ­a haber sido clave para haber desnivelado la pugna Loeb-Sainz del lado galo. Si no existiÃ³ ningÃºn compaÃ±erismo entre [Loeb ](/tags/sebastien-loeb/)y Nasser, todo lo contrario ocurriÃ³ entre Sainz y sus compaÃ±eros Mattias EkstrÃ¶m y StÃ©phane Peterhansel. Durante la segunda semana, ambos le abrieron el paso en muchas ocasiones y le â€˜escoltaronâ€™ en otras con tal de que Sainz tuviera unas manos amigas con las que arreglar el coche en caso de cualquier problema. En la antepenÃºltima etapa, por ejemplo, al madrileÃ±o no le quedaban ruedas de repuesto, pero sin embargo pinchÃ³ una tercera ocasiÃ³n. AsÃ­, esperÃ³ siete minutos al sueco EkstrÃ¶m, quien le cediÃ³ dos ruedas para que no tuviera problemas para seguir como lÃ­der a su llegada a meta. Una gran estrategia Jugar con la estrategia fue clave para el triunfo final del de Audi. No le saliÃ³ la jugada en el prÃ³logo, en el que quiso quedar entre la dÃ©cima y la dÃ©cimo quinta posiciÃ³n para salir el dÃ­a siguiente con las trazas de los demÃ¡s. Pero Sainz se pasÃ³ de frenada y parÃ³ demasiado, lo que le hizo salir mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la vigÃ©sima posiciÃ³n. AprendiÃ³ de esa mala jugada en la quinta etapa, en la que se volviÃ³ a parar para no salir primero pero le saliÃ³ mucho mejor. Mientras que Al-Attiyah abrÃ­a pista por un desierto de dunas muy difÃ­cil en la navegaciÃ³n, Sainz salÃ­a a dos minutos del coche de delante, por lo que enseguida empezÃ³ a seguir trazadas y a copiar momentos de frenada para empezar a adelantar vehÃ­culos de cara a una etapa que terminÃ³ en exhibiciÃ³n. Lo repitiÃ³ para la penÃºltima etapa. El madrileÃ±o saliÃ³ diez minutos por detrÃ¡s de Loeb y seis minutos por delante de EkstrÃ¶m. En caso de averÃ­a del galo, lo sabrÃ­a al momento, como asÃ­ ocurriÃ³, mientras que si necesitaba ruedas, sÃ³lo tendrÃ­a que esperar seis minutos a que llegara el sueco. Una estrategia que saliÃ³ de diez para certificar el liderato de Sainz en la general. Todo ello terminÃ³ por asegurar el cuarto Dakar de Sainz, un triunfo contundente, con mÃ¡s de una hora y veinte minutos del segundo, en el rey de los rallies.

author: globo.com
title: Homem Ã© indiciado por estupro cometido em encontro de amigos: 'VÃ­tima estava incapaz de oferecer resistÃªncia', diz PolÃ­cia Civil | Grande Minas | G1
text:
1 de 1 Delegacia da PolÃ­cia Civil em Taiobeiras â€” Foto: PolÃ­cia Civil Delegacia da PolÃ­cia Civil em Taiobeiras â€” Foto: PolÃ­cia Civil
Um homem foi indiciado por estupro de vulnerÃ¡vel e importunaÃ§Ã£o sexual cometidos durante um encontro de amigos em Taiobeiras . Segundo informaÃ§Ãµes divulgadas pela PolÃ­cia Civil (PC) nesta quarta-feira (9), o abuso sexual foi filmado.
Os levantamentos feitos pela Delegacia Especializada de Atendimento Ã  Mulher (Deam), apontam que no dia 24 de fevereiro de 2024, um grupo de amigos se reuniu e consumiu bebidas alcoÃ³licas. Conforme a PC, o investigado, de 34 anos, se aproveitou da vulnerabilidade da vÃ­tima, â€œque estava inconsciente e incapaz de oferecer resistÃªnciaâ€.
Conforme a PC, uma amiga da vÃ­tima, que ficou preocupada com o que aconteceria com ela, deixou o celular no quarto da mulher. O vÃ­deo foi entregue para a delegada Mayra Coutinho, responsÃ¡vel pelo caso. Por meio das imagens, o abuso ficou constatado.
â€œO inquÃ©rito foi instruÃ­do com depoimentos detalhados, extraÃ§Ã£o e anÃ¡lise de dados do celular do investigado, alÃ©m da perÃ­cia do vÃ­deo entregue pela testemunhaâ€, falou a delegada.
Ainda conforme Mayra Coutinho, uma testemunha tambÃ©m afirmou ter sido vÃ­tima de importunaÃ§Ã£o sexual por parte do investigado quando o grupo ainda estava na casa da vÃ­tima.
â€œDurante o exame pericial no celular do investigado, foram identificados indÃ­cios de outros possÃ­veis crimes sexuais envolvendo o suspeito, os quais serÃ£o apurados em procedimento apartadoâ€, acrescentou a delegada.

author: Rob Moss
title: Sky to close call centres cutting 2,000 jobs
text:
Three Sky call centres in the north of England are to be closed and another two reduced in size, with around 2,000 job cuts.
The changes, announced to staff yesterday, will affect around 7% of the media and telecoms companyâ€™s UK workforce, and are subject to consultation.
Three of Skyâ€™s 10 call centres â€“ Leeds, Sheffield and Stockport â€“ will close, with offices in Newcastle and Dunfermline scaled back.
The company, which was acquired by US media giant Comcast in 2018, cited changing customer preferences and declining call volumes.
A survey of 10,000 customers found they wanted flexibility in how they contacted the company, with most people preferring digital access for day-to-day tasks such as paying a bill or making changes to their contract.
Sky plans to invest in â€œadvanced digital servicesâ€ to replace phone contact services and a state-of-the-art centre of excellence in Livingston, near Edinburgh, as part of a transformation â€œto deliver quicker, simpler and more digital customer serviceâ€.
A spokesman for Sky said: â€œWeâ€™re transforming our business to deliver quicker, simpler, and more digital customer service. Our customers increasingly want choice, to speak to us on the phone when they need us most and the ease of managing everyday tasks digitally.
â€œWeâ€™re investing in a new centre of excellence for customer service, alongside cutting-edge digital technology to make our service seamless, reliable, and available 24/7. This is about building a future-ready Sky that continues to put our customers and their needs first.â€
Sky receives around 25 million calls from its customers across Europe each year, but this is expected to reduce by a third over the coming few years
In January 2024, Sky announced it was cutting around 1,000 jobs, with a significant number of engineering roles affected.

author: @WCTV
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say itâ€™s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. â€œYou couldnâ€™t see anything but rain and water,â€ Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. â€œThe water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,â€ Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. â€œWe were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,â€ Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. â€œI remembered they needed to know the address, so thatâ€™s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,â€ Mikeâ€™s and Gingerâ€™s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, Mike and Ginger Bellâ€™s daughter, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. â€œI went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasnâ€™t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,â€ Mike Bell recounted from that moment. â€œAt that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, â€˜We need flotation devices.â€™â€ Thatâ€™s where little Hank Bell came in. â€œI didnâ€™t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,â€ Hank Bell explained. â€œI went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.â€ Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. â€œHe went into the ladyâ€™s side and I went into the manâ€™s side,â€ Ginger Bell said. â€œShe was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and thatâ€™s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.â€ Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. â€œWhen he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,â€ Ginger Bell remembered. â€œI looked at her and I said, â€˜Iâ€™m stuck, I canâ€™t,â€™â€ Dean Ramsey remembered. â€œAt that time, I was like, â€˜Iâ€™m going down with the car,â€™ but sheâ€™s like, â€˜Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!â€™ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.â€ The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as â€œguardian angels.â€ The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Rylee Wilson
title: Georgia Medicaid shakeup could force 3 in 4 beneficiaries to change plans: Centene CEO
text:
Georgia's Medicaid contract awards could cause three in four Medicaid recipients in the state to switch plans, according to Centene CEO Sarah London.
The state said it would [grant ](https://www.beckerspayer.com/contracting/georgia-to-award-4-medicaid-contracts.html)Medicaid contracts to Humana, CareSource, Molina and UnitedHealthcare, on Dec. 2. Centene, who currently holds a contract with the state, did not receive a new contract.
At the company's [investor day](https://investors.centene.com/Centene-Corporation-December-2024-Investor-Day) on Dec. 12, Ms. London said Centene was disappointed in the initial results.
"As we review the information that we have today, we have some concerns about the process," Ms. London said. "Broadly, we have some real concerns about a policy decision that would make 75% of Medicaid members in Georgia choose a different plan while initiating a complex [aged, blind and disabled] program."
Ms. London said Centene intends to challenge the decision.
Some states have walked back contract awards that would cause a significant share of Medicaid beneficiaries to switch to new insurers. In 2023, California [awarded](https://www.beckerspayer.com/contracting/in-major-reversal-california-awards-additional-medicaid-contracts.html) more payers contracts to manage its Medicaid program, reversing course on contract awards that could have forced two million Medi-Cal members to switch insurance.
Texas [paused](https://www.beckerspayer.com/contracting/texas-delays-medicaid-contract-awards.html) implementing its newly awarded contracts until 2025, pausing a shakeup that could have led 1.8 million beneficiaries to switch plans.
Becker's has reached out to representatives for Georgia's Department of Community Health, which manages its Medicaid program, for comment, and will update this story if more information becomes available.
Georgia has nearly 2 million Medicaid enrollees, according to data from [KFF. ](https://files.kff.org/attachment/fact-sheet-medicaid-state-GA)
